commit.message:
ndctl: release v78

This release incorporates functionality up to the 6.5 kernel.

Highlights include fixes to cxl-monitor and ndctl-monitor, a new
cxl-update-firmware command, various documentation fixes, and a new unit
test for cxl events.

Commands:
  cxl-update-firmware: new command to update firmware on CXL memdevs
  {cxl,ndctl}-monitor: fixes for option handling for logging

Tests:
  cxl-events.sh: new test for CXL events

APIs:
  cxl_cmd_fw_info_get_active_slot
  cxl_cmd_fw_info_get_fw_ver
  cxl_cmd_fw_info_get_num_slots
  cxl_cmd_fw_info_get_online_activate_capable
  cxl_cmd_fw_info_get_staged_slot
  cxl_cmd_new_get_fw_info
  cxl_memdev_cancel_fw_update
  cxl_memdev_fw_update_get_remaining
  cxl_memdev_fw_update_in_progress
  cxl_memdev_update_fw

ndctl: release v78

This release incorporates functionality up to the 6.5 kernel.

Highlights include fixes to cxl-monitor and ndctl-monitor, a new
cxl-update-firmware command, various documentation fixes, and a new unit
test for cxl events.

Commands:
  cxl-update-firmware: new command to update firmware on CXL memdevs
  {cxl,ndctl}-monitor: fixes for option handling for logging

Tests:
  cxl-events.sh: new test for CXL events

APIs:
  cxl_cmd_fw_info_get_active_slot
  cxl_cmd_fw_info_get_fw_ver
  cxl_cmd_fw_info_get_num_slots
  cxl_cmd_fw_info_get_online_activate_capable
  cxl_cmd_fw_info_get_staged_slot
  cxl_cmd_new_get_fw_info
  cxl_memdev_cancel_fw_update
  cxl_memdev_fw_update_get_remaining
  cxl_memdev_fw_update_in_progress
  cxl_memdev_update_fw

commit.message:
daxctl: fix warning reported by udevadm verify

Fix the following warning reported by udevadm verify:

daxctl/90-daxctl-device.rules:3 Whitespace after comma is expected.
daxctl/90-daxctl-device.rules: udev rules check failed

Signed-off-by: "Dmitry V. Levin" <ldv@strace.io>
Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230520004110.GA1677@altlinux.org
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

cxl/memdev: initialize 'rc' in action_update_fw()

Static analysis complains that in some cases, an uninitialized 'rc' can
get returned from action_update_fw(). Since this can only happen in a
'no-op' case, initialize rc to 0.

Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230731-coverity-fix-v1-1-9b70ff6aa388@intel.com
Fixes: 64ad46b4a147 ("cxl: add an update-firmware command")
Reviewed-by: Dave Jiang <dave.jiang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

ndctl/cxl/test: Add CXL event test

Previously CXL event testing was run by hand.  Improve testing coverage
and address a lack of automated regression testing by adding a unit test
for this.

Add a CXL event test as part of the meson test infrastructure.  Passing
is predicated on receiving the appropriate number of errors in each log.
Individual event values are not checked.

Signed-off-by: Ira Weiny <ira.weiny@intel.com>
Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230726-cxl-event-v2-1-550f5625d22f@intel.com
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

ndctl/security: fix Theory of Operation typos

Noticed while reading the file.

Signed-off-by: Davidlohr Bueso <dave@stgolabs.net>
Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230725015457.31084-1-dave@stgolabs.net
Reviewed-by: Dave Jiang <dave.jiang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

Merge branch 'for-78/fw_update' into pending

Add firmware update functionality to libcxl and cxl-cli.

Patch 1 is a preparatory patch that teaches memdev based commands to
filter their operand memdevs by bus. This helps restricting unit test
operations to the cxl_test bus.

Patches 2 and 3 add firmware information to the CXL memdev listing. This
is derived from the 'Get FW Info' mailbox command as well as state
information in the kernel's firmware loader mechanism in sysfs.

Patch 4 adds the libcxl APIs to perform a firmware update, and to cancel
an in-progress update, and the cxl-cli command to use these APIs to
start, wait for, and cancel firmware updates. A man page for the new
command is added as well.

Patch 5 adds a unit test to exercise all the features described above in
a cxl_test environment.

test/cxl-update-firmware: add a unit test for firmware update

Add a unit test to exercise the different operating modes of the
cxl-update-firmware command. Perform an update synchronously,
asynchronously, on multiple devices, and attempt cancellation of an
in-progress update.

Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230405-vv-fw_update-v2-5-a778a15e860b@intel.com
Cc: Dan Williams <dan.j.williams@intel.com>
Reviewed-by: Dave Jiang <dave.jiang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

cxl: add an update-firmware command

Add a new cxl-update-firmware command to initiate a firmware update on a
given memdev. This allows using a specified file to pass in as the
firmware binary for one or more memdevs, allows for a blocking mode,
where the command only exits after the update is complete for every
specified memdev, and includes an option to cancel an in-progress
update. Add the supporting libcxl APIs for the above functions as well.

Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230405-vv-fw_update-v2-4-a778a15e860b@intel.com
Reviewed-by: Dave Jiang <dave.jiang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

cxl/fw_loader: add APIs to get current state of the FW loader mechanism

Add a way to interface with the firmware loader mechanism for cxl
memdevs. Add APIs to retrieve the current status of the fw loader, and
the remaining size if a fw upload is in progress. Display these in the
'firmware' section of memdev listings.

Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230405-vv-fw_update-v2-3-a778a15e860b@intel.com
Cc: Dan Williams <dan.j.williams@intel.com>
Reviewed-by: Dave Jiang <dave.jiang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

cxl/list: print firmware info in memdev listings

Add libcxl APIs to send a 'Get Firmware Info' mailbox command, and
accessors for its data fields. Add a json representation of this data,
and add an option to cxl-list to display it under memdev listings.

Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230405-vv-fw_update-v2-2-a778a15e860b@intel.com
Cc: Dan Williams <dan.j.williams@intel.com>
Reviewed-by: Dave Jiang <dave.jiang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

cxl/memdev.c: allow filtering memdevs by bus

The family of memdev based commands implemented in memdev.c lacked an
option to filter the operation by bus. Add a helper to filter memdevs by
the bus they're under, and use it in memdev_action() which loops through
the requested memdevs. Update the man pages for all the affected
commands as well to include the bus filter option.

Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230405-vv-fw_update-v2-1-a778a15e860b@intel.com
Cc: Dan Williams <dan.j.williams@intel.com>
Cc: Alison Schofield <alison.schofield@intel.com>
Reviewed-by: Dave Jiang <dave.jiang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

cxl/region: Fix memdevs leak in parse_create_options()

Release p->memdevs in the error paths out of parse_create_options().

Signed-off-by: Li Zhijian <lizhijian@fujitsu.com>
Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230531022718.7691-1-lizhijian@fujitsu.com
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

README.md: document setup steps for CXL unit tests

CXL unit tests require some CXL specific kconfigs and installation of
the cxl_test module (similar to nfit_test). Add a section on this to
README.md.

Signed-off-by: Li Zhijian <lizhijian@fujitsu.com>
Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230531022414.7604-2-lizhijian@fujitsu.com
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

CONTRIBUTING.md: Add note about the CXL mailing list

Changes and questions relevant to CXL should also CC the CXL mailing
list. Add a note about this to CONTRIBUTING.md.

Reviewed-by: Dave Jiang <dave.jiang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Li Zhijian <lizhijian@fujitsu.com>
Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230531022414.7604-1-lizhijian@fujitsu.com
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

Merge branch 'for-78/monitor-fixes' into pending

These mainly fix the monitor commands not working when a log file is
specified.  For example:

  $ cxl monitor -l ./cxl-monitor.log

Further, it compares the filename with reserved word 'standard' more
accurately, and cleans up some inconsistencies in the monitor man pages.

Documentation/cxl/cxl-monitor.txt: Remove mention of syslog output

Output to the syslog is not implemented in cxl-monitor. Remove it from
the man page as well.

Reviewed-by: Dave Jiang <dave.jiang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Li Zhijian <lizhijian@fujitsu.com>
Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230711115344.562823-5-lizhijian@fujitsu.com
Reviewed-by: Alison Schofield <alison.schofield@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

ndctl: use strcmp for reserved word in monitor commands

According to the documentation, when '-l standard' is specified, the log
would be sent to stdout. But since it's using strncmp(a, b, 10) to
compare the first 10 characters, it will incorrectly detect a filename
starting with a substring 'standard' as stdout.

For example:

  $ cxl monitor -l standard.log

User is most likely want to save log to ./standard.log instead of stdout.

Change this to a 'strcmp' so that the whole string is considered.

Reviewed-by: Dave Jiang <dave.jiang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Li Zhijian <lizhijian@fujitsu.com>
Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230711115344.562823-4-lizhijian@fujitsu.com
Reviewed-by: Alison Schofield <alison.schofield@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

cxl/monitor: replace monitor.log_file with monitor.ctx.log_file

Commit ba5825b0b7e0 ("ndctl/monitor: move common logging functions to util/log.c")
replaced monitor.log_file with monitor.ctx.log_file for ndctl-monitor,
but neglected to do the same for cxl-monitor.

As a result, if the user specifies a logfile, a segmentation fault is
trggered as below:

  # build/cxl/cxl monitor -l ./monitor.log
  Segmentation fault (core dumped)

Use the correct structure and variable location to fix this.

Fixes: 299f69f974a6 ("cxl/monitor: add a new monitor command for CXL trace events")
Reviewed-by: Dave Jiang <dave.jiang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Li Zhijian <lizhijian@fujitsu.com>
Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230711115344.562823-3-lizhijian@fujitsu.com
Reviewed-by: Alison Schofield <alison.schofield@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

cxl/monitor: Enable default_log and refactor sanity checks

The default_log (/var/log/cxl-monitor.log) should be used when no '-l'
argument is specified in daemon mode, but this has been broken.

Simplify the sanity checks so that the default log file is assigned
correctly, and the behavior is consistent with the documentation.

Remove the unnecessary fix_filename() for monitor.log since
parse_options_prefix() would have already done any necessary fixups.

Reviewed-by: Dave Jiang <dave.jiang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Li Zhijian <lizhijian@fujitsu.com>
Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230711115344.562823-2-lizhijian@fujitsu.com
Reviewed-by: Alison Schofield <alison.schofield@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

meson.build: add libtracefs version >=1.2.0 dependency

Compile with libtracefs < 1.2.0(1.0.2 in Fedora33) will get errors:

/usr/bin/ld: cxl/cxl.p/event_trace.c.o: in function `cxl_event_tracing_enable':
/path/to/ndctl/build/../cxl/event_trace.c:238: undefined reference to `tracefs_event_enable'
/usr/bin/ld: /path/to/ndctl/build/../cxl/event_trace.c:242: undefined reference to `tracefs_trace_is_on'
/usr/bin/ld: /path/to/ndctl/build/../cxl/event_trace.c:245: undefined reference to `tracefs_trace_on'
/usr/bin/ld: cxl/cxl.p/event_trace.c.o: in function `cxl_event_tracing_disable':
/path/to/ndctl/build/../cxl/event_trace.c:251: undefined reference to `tracefs_trace_off'
/usr/bin/ld: cxl/cxl.p/monitor.c.o: in function `monitor_event':
/path/to/ndctl/build/../cxl/monitor.c:74: undefined reference to `tracefs_instance_file_open'

Signed-off-by: Li Zhijian <lizhijian@fujitsu.com>
Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230512081026.735459-1-lizhijian@fujitsu.com
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

rpmbuild.sh: Abort script when an error occurs

Abort early so that the real error message can be noticed easily.
==========================
$ ./rpmbuild.sh
Found CMake: /usr/bin/cmake (3.18.4)
Run-time dependency libtraceevent found: NO (tried pkgconfig and cmake)

../meson.build:147:2: ERROR: Dependency "libtraceevent" not found, tried pkgconfig and cmake

A full log can be found at /path/to/ndctl/build/meson-logs/meson-log.txt
FAILED: build.ninja
...

Signed-off-by: Li Zhijian <lizhijian@fujitsu.com>
Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230511073657.706429-1-lizhijian@fujitsu.com
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

README.md: add three additional config to config item list

CONFIG_NVDIMM_SECURITY_TEST is required for nfit-security.sh and
cxl-security.sh.
CONGIF_STRICT_DEVMEM and CONFIG_IO_STRICT_DEVME are required for
revoke_devmem.

Ref: #240 #241

Signed-off-by: Yi Zhang <yi.zhang@redhat.com>
Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230516121730.2561605-1-yi.zhang@redhat.com
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>
Merge branch 'for-78/minwoo/typo-fixes' into pending

typo fix: ovewrite -> overwrite

Fix typos in Documentation/ndctl/ndctl-sanitize-dimm.txt and ndctl/lib/dimm.c

Signed-off-by: Yi Zhang <yi.zhang@redhat.com>
Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230509230005.2122950-1-yi.zhang@redhat.com
Reviewed-by: Dave Jiang <dave.jiang@intel.com>
Reviewed-by: Minwoo Im <minwoo.im.dev@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

cxl: fix changed function name in a comment

cxl_memdev_target_find_decoder() has been renamed to
cxl_memdev_find_decoder in commit 21b089025178 ("cxl: add a
'create-region' command").  Fix function name in a comment.

Signed-off-by: Minwoo Im <minwoo.im.dev@gmail.com>
Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230509152427.6920-2-minwoo.im.dev@gmail.com
Reviewed-by: Dave Jiang <dave.jiang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

cxl: region: remove redundant func name from error

If user does not provide `-s, --size` option and there's no ep_min_size
configured, it prints error log like the following.  This patch removes
redundant repeated function name from the log.

Before:

  root@vm:~/work# cxl create-region -m -d decoder0.0 -w 1 -g 1024 mem0
  cxl region: create_region: create_region: unable to determine region size
  cxl region: cmd_create_region: created 0 regions

After:
  root@vm:~/work# cxl create-region -m -d decoder0.0 -w 1 -g 1024 mem0
  cxl region: create_region: unable to determine region size
  cxl region: cmd_create_region: created 0 regions

Signed-off-by: Minwoo Im <minwoo.im.dev@gmail.com>
Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230509152427.6920-2-minwoo.im.dev@gmail.com
Reviewed-by: Dave Jiang <dave.jiang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

cxl/list: Fix typo in cxl-list documentation

s/the returned the returned object/the returned object
s/ellided/elided
s/hierararchy/hierarchy
s/specifed/specified
s/identidier/identifier
s/scenerios/scenarios

Signed-off-by: Minwoo Im <minwoo.im.dev@gmail.com>
Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230509152427.6920-2-minwoo.im.dev@gmail.com
Reviewed-by: Dave Jiang <dave.jiang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

ndctl: release v77

This release incorporates functionality up to the 6.3 kernel.

Highlights include some build fixes around cx-monitor and event tracing,
the ability to create ram type regions, some fixes to create-region to
allow a user-supplied UUID, cxl-list fixes for RCD devices, and region
listings, cxl-list filtering improvements, and some unit test fixes.

Commands:
  cxl-list: Include regions in the verbose listing
  cxl-list: Enumerate device-dax properties for regions
  cxl-list: Fix filtering RCDs
  cxl-list: Filter root decoders by region
  cxl-list: Add parent_dport attribute to port listings
  cxl-list: Add a type attribute to region listings
  cxl-create-region: add creation of ram type regions
  cxl-create-region: skip region_actions for region creation
  cxl-create-region: automatic type detection based on memdev capacity

Tests:
  all: fix module load path expectations
  libndctl: fix dangling pointer warnings
  cxl-security.sh: use the correct 'cxl' binary

APIs:
  cxl_decoder_create_ram_region
  cxl_port_get_parent_dport
  cxl_region_get_daxctl_region
  cxl_region_get_mode

ndctl: release v77

This release incorporates functionality up to the 6.3 kernel.

Highlights include some build fixes around cx-monitor and event tracing,
the ability to create ram type regions, some fixes to create-region to
allow a user-supplied UUID, cxl-list fixes for RCD devices, and region
listings, cxl-list filtering improvements, and some unit test fixes.

Commands:
  cxl-list: Include regions in the verbose listing
  cxl-list: Enumerate device-dax properties for regions
  cxl-list: Fix filtering RCDs
  cxl-list: Filter root decoders by region
  cxl-list: Add parent_dport attribute to port listings
  cxl-list: Add a type attribute to region listings
  cxl-create-region: add creation of ram type regions
  cxl-create-region: skip region_actions for region creation
  cxl-create-region: automatic type detection based on memdev capacity

Tests:

  cxl_region_get_mode

commit.message:
ndctl/namespace.c: fix unchecked return value from uuid_parse()

Static analysis reports that write_pfn_sb() neglects to check the return
value from uuid_parse as is done elsewhere. Since the uuid being parsed
comes from the user, check for failure, and return an EINVAL if so.

Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20230502-vv-coverity-v1-1-079352646ba2@intel.com
Cc: Dan Williams <dan.j.williams@intel.com>
Reviewed-by: Dan Williams <dan.j.williams@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>

cxl/list: Add parent_dport attribute to port listings

Record parent_dports in libcxl's cxl_port objects, and display them in
port listings when applicable.

This was originally 6df696a5debf ("cxl/list: Add parent_dport attribute
to port listings"), and reverted in b9ecc503d5de ("Revert "cxl/list: Add
parent_dport attribute to port listings""). It is now applicable since
v77 will correspond to kernel v6.3, and the referenced kernel commit is
now available.

Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/167053491908.582963.7783814693644991382.stgit@dwillia2-xfh.jf.intel.com
Signed-off-by: Dan Williams <dan.j.williams@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Vishal Verma <vishal.l.verma@intel.com>
